data.title: Counting right-angled triangles
data.statement:
You are given a list of n points with their (x,y) coordinates.
You have to determine the number of right-angled triangles composed of any 3 of these points.

(Hint) A right triangle can be checked either by using the Pythagorean theorem, or by testing that the dot product of two side vectors is zero.

testCases.title: Triangle on x and y axis
Triangle on x and y axis

data.constraints:
3 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 20
-100 < [[x]],[[y]] < 100
You can be sure that no two points will be identical

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given a list of n points with their (x,y) coordinates.
You have to determine the number of right-angled triangles composed of any 3 of these points.

(Hint) A right triangle can be checked either by using the Pythagorean theorem, or by testing that the dot product of two side vectors is zero.
Input
Ligne 1 : An integer N representing the number of points.
N next lignes : Two integers x and y representing the coordinates of each point
Output
Ligne 1 : The number of right-angled triangles that can be formed with these points
Constraints
3 ≤ N ≤ 20
-100 < x,y < 100
You can be sure that no two points will be identical
Example
Input
3
0 0
0 3
4 0
Output
1
